title: Best entity-extraction AI Tools - Top Picks for 2025
metaDescription: Discover the 9 best entity-extraction AI tools in 2025. Compare features, pricing & reviews to find the perfect tool for your needs.
introduction: Looking for the best entity-extraction AI tools in 2025? We've analyzed hundreds of tools to bring you this curated list of the top 9 options. Whether you're a developer, business, or individual user, this guide helps you choose the right entity-extraction AI tool.

platforms.name: Google Cloud Natural Language
platforms.description: Google Cloud Natural Language is a managed AI service that uses Google's pre-trained machine learning models to analyze and extract insights from unstructured text. Its key capabilities include entity recognition, sentiment analysis, content classification, and syntax parsing, supporting multiple languages. It is designed for developers, data scientists, and businesses needing to integrate advanced NLP into applications without building models from scratch, and is unique for its deep integration with Google's search and knowledge graph data.
keyFeatures: Entity Recognition with metadata (salience, type, Wikipedia URLs)
Sentiment Analysis scoring magnitude and sentiment per entity/document
Content Classification into 700+ predefined categories

platforms.name: MonkeyLearn
platforms.description: MonkeyLearn is a no-code AI platform that enables users to analyze and visualize text data for business insights. Its key capabilities include building custom machine learning models for classification and extraction, performing sentiment analysis, and integrating directly with tools like Google Sheets, Excel, and Zapier. It uniquely targets business analysts, marketers, and support teams by offering an accessible, visual interface that demystifies NLP without requiring coding or data science expertise.
keyFeatures: Custom classifier builder for topic classification and intent detection
Custom extractor for pulling specific keywords, entities, and data points
Pre-built & trainable sentiment analysis models

platforms.name: Lexalytics
platforms.description: Lexalytics is an enterprise-grade natural language processing (NLP) and text analytics platform. It specializes in deriving actionable insights from unstructured text data through core capabilities like sentiment analysis, intent detection, entity extraction, and thematic categorization. Its key differentiator is a highly accurate, rules-based 'Semantria' engine combined with machine learning, offering deep configurability, on-premise deployment for data security, and pre-built taxonomies for specific industries like finance and healthcare.
keyFeatures: Granular sentiment & emotion scoring (positive/negative/neutral, plus emotions like anger, joy)
Configurable entity extraction (people, places, brands, custom types)
Theme & concept detection using industry-specific taxonomies (e.g., finance, hospitality)

platforms.name: Language Understanding Intelligent Service (LUIS)
platforms.description: Language Understanding Intelligent Service (LUIS) is a legacy Microsoft Azure cloud service for building custom natural language understanding (NLU) models. It enables developers to add intent classification and entity extraction capabilities to conversational applications like chatbots and voice assistants. While it was a key component of Microsoft's conversational AI stack, it has been officially deprecated in favor of Azure Cognitive Services for Language, which offers enhanced capabilities and unified tooling.
keyFeatures: Custom intent classification with active learning suggestions
Entity extraction for prebuilt, machine-learned, list, and pattern-based entities
Prebuilt domains and entities for common scenarios (e.g., calendar, places)

platforms.name: AYLIEN
platforms.description: AYLIEN is a News Intelligence and Text Analysis API platform that enables businesses to extract actionable insights from vast amounts of news content and unstructured text data. Its key capabilities include entity-level sentiment analysis, topic classification, and multilingual summarization, primarily targeting media monitoring, financial services, and market research professionals. What makes it unique is its deep focus on news-specific NLP, offering granular entity recognition and sentiment tracking across global news sources in real-time.
keyFeatures: News API with search & filtering across 80M+ articles from 30K+ sources
Entity-level sentiment analysis (positive/negative/neutral per entity)
Multi-label IAB & IPTC news category classification

platforms.name: Azure Conversational Language Understanding
platforms.description: Azure Conversational Language Understanding (CLU) is a cloud-based AI service for building natural language understanding models that extract intents and entities from conversational text. It is the designated successor to LUIS (Language Understanding Intelligent Service), designed for low-data scenarios and supports multilingual applications out of the box. Its key capabilities include low-code authoring in Language Studio and robust enterprise-grade security, making it uniquely suited for developers and enterprises building sophisticated, production-ready conversational agents within the Microsoft ecosystem.
keyFeatures: Low-code model authoring via Azure Language Studio interface
Multilingual intent recognition (supports multiple languages in a single project)
Custom entity extraction (learned, list, prebuilt, and regex entities)

platforms.name: Dandelion API
platforms.description: Dandelion API is a European-based semantic text analytics service that enables developers and businesses to extract meaning from unstructured text. Its core capabilities include entity extraction, sentiment analysis, text classification, and language detection, supporting over 100 languages. It uniquely focuses on semantic understanding and entity linking to Wikipedia/Wikidata, making it particularly strong for knowledge graph enrichment and content analysis in multilingual contexts.
keyFeatures: Named Entity Extraction with links to Wikipedia/Wikidata entries
Multilingual Sentiment Analysis (positive/negative/neutral) for sentences and documents
Text Classification into IAB or IPTC news categories

platforms.name: NetOwl
platforms.description: NetOwl is an enterprise-grade suite of natural language processing (NLP) and entity analytics products developed by Basis Technology. It specializes in extracting, linking, and analyzing entities (people, organizations, locations) from vast amounts of multilingual, unstructured text and PDF data. Its key capabilities include high-accuracy entity extraction, identity resolution across documents, and sentiment analysis, primarily targeting government, intelligence, and large corporate clients who need to process complex, sensitive, and multilingual documents at scale. What makes it unique is its long-standing focus on low-resource languages, its deep integration with identity resolution for counter-threat intelligence, and its proven deployment in high-security, on-premises environments.
keyFeatures: Multilingual Entity Extraction (100+ languages)
Identity Resolution & Cross-Document Entity Linking
Sentiment & Emotion Analysis at entity/document level

platforms.name: PolyAnalyst
platforms.description: PolyAnalyst is a comprehensive data and text analytics platform developed by Megaputer Intelligence, designed to extract insights from unstructured and structured data. Its key capabilities include automated text mining, sentiment analysis, entity extraction, and predictive modeling, enabling users to uncover patterns and trends. It uniquely combines advanced linguistic analysis with visual analytics and is targeted at enterprise analysts, data scientists, and business intelligence professionals who need to process large volumes of textual data for decision-making.
keyFeatures: Automated text mining with pattern discovery and categorization
Sentiment analysis for customer feedback and social media monitoring
Entity extraction (people, organizations, locations) from documents

howToChoose: Define your specific needs and use cases for entity-extraction AI tools
Consider your budget and team size
Evaluate required integrations with existing tools
Check free trials or free tiers before committing
Read user reviews and case studies
verdict: All 9 entity-extraction AI tools on this list are excellent choices, each with unique strengths. Google Cloud Natural Language leads with google-cloud, while MonkeyLearn offers no-code-ai. Your best choice depends on your specific requirements, budget, and technical expertise.
